dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3673 RH: Small Business Investor Capital Access Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Barr (for himself and Ms. Velázquez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on June 3, 2025

form.official-title: To amend the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 to increase the exemption from registration threshold for certain investment advisers of private funds to reflect the change in inflation.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Investor Capital Access Act.

section.header: Inflation adjustment for the exemption threshold for certain investment advisers of private funds
section.text: Section 203(m) of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C. 80b–3(m)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking $150,000,000 and inserting $175,000,000; and
by adding at the end the following:

The Commission shall, every 5 years, adjust the dollar amount described under paragraph (1) to reflect the change in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor, and round such dollar amount to the nearest multiple of $1,000,000.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
